Summary Dynamic, versatile Global Business Operations Analyst with over 20+ years Marketing experience, including President of Board of Directors for American Marketing Association and recipient of multiple awards. An entrepreneur known for successfully driving new initiatives, having launched corporations and established strategic objectives in start-environments. Exceptional marketing skills combined with proven ability to drive corporate strategy, manage and nurture talent, deliver sales growth, and successfully engage and oversee complex ventures. Outstanding strategist and expert at implementing process that delivers greater efficiency with demonstrated ability to promote sources into resources and revenue. Distinguished for proven leadership, team-building skills, and excellent conflict resolution tactics combined with a keen ability to create, build, and lead global business relationships. Attested management skills that enhance productivity, to drive sustained organizational performance. Summary Mike brings a wealth of management experience, with 20 years of design and operations management and nearly 10 years of public service. Much of this time was spent in entrepreneurial ventures and startup businesses, where Mike built high performing teams that delivered solid results. 
 
Mike currently serves as Director of Hardware Engineering at Roku, a market leader in streaming entertainment devices. In this role, Mike directs hardware development and contract manufacturer management for streamer set-top boxes and televisions.  
 
Previously, Mike held the Director of Hardware Design and Manufacturing position for Intel Media's OnCue business unit. He directed business development, hardware architecture, electrical and mechanical design, platform validation, technology development, high-volume manufacturing, and firmware development. 
 
Prior to this, Mike was Director of Platform engineering in the Digital Home Group. In this role, he led a team of more than 100 resources, developing platforms to enable design and marketing of Intel television and set-top box SOCs (System on Chip). He led a multi-disciplined team including hardware, software, and operations, implementing flexible resourcing models with off-shore partners and directing ODM engagements to deliver branded consumer electronics products.  
 
Mike managed teams in the Desktop Products and Solutions Division, which focused on technology development for high volume desktop motherboards. Earlier in his career, he also performed business operations and technical marketing roles in the Flash Products Division. 
 
Mike is active in the community. He was elected to the Hillsboro, Oregon City Council for two terms, overseeing a $350M budget and setting strategic direction of the City, with a board of six other councilors. In this role, he championed key economic development, livability, and infrastructure initiatives.
